submissions.name: Inaugural language
submissions.creator: The Boston Globe
submissions.description: "American inaugural addresses often cover similar ground. They celebrate American values while looking forward to the future, but the vocabulary has changed over the decades.... The following graphs visualize inaugural addresses words. Each dot represents one word. Darker dots indicate more frequent usage. The graph radius represents duration of speech. Common English words have been removed."

submissions.name: How much water is in your scallop?
submissions.creator: The Boston Globe
submissions.description: "A Globe investigation of 21 grocery stores and seafood markets across Massachusetts found scallops with water levels far exceeding industry standards."

submissions.name: Where the best and worst tippers in America Live
submissions.creator: Quartz
submissions.description: Payment service Square provided Quartz with data on tens of millions of food-service transactions across the US. This shows that tips for waiters, baristas, and food-truck workers vary significantly according to location.
